document.description: Berlitz Where to Go in Hong Kong
document.name: WhereToHongKong

sentence.text: And once they were christened , as we might expect , the ` Hooligans " were understood as an entirely unprecedented and ` un-British " phenomenon : indeed , we must allow that it was most ingenious of late Victorian England to disown the British Hooligan by giving him an ` Irish " name .
But human beings are endlessly ingenious about promoting their own misery .
The brands on buffaloes were difficult to read after a couple of years , and thieves were ingenious at altering them .

A hegemonal class may be more or less ingenious at furthering its political interest while maintaining its position in the power bloc ; the working class may make better or worse use of a revolutionary situation .
He was a magnificent surgical technician , a perfectionist who constantly improved his techniques and ingenious in developing many new surgical instruments and splints .
By the 1870s New York had an ingenious solution to its transport problems : the elevated railway , Third Avenue , New York , 1879 .
Durkheim developed this ingenious thesis by contrasting the economic and social conditions in primitive and modern societies .
Even so the most ingenious phraseology could not truly reconcile the many disparate concerns of the allies .
The choice of a robot as an on-screen guide is ingenious ; it speaks without lip movements , so that the film can easily be dubbed into foreign languages .
You can simply enjoy watching your players come up with ingenious , crazy or simply bizarre plans to avoid the inevitable .
Sampson 's attack on Chomsky 's account of how the child overcomes this problem is ingenious .
The experimental demonstration is quite ingenious .
The courtships of spiders are beguilingly various and ingenious .
Begging , sometimes very ingenious , is rife , in urban areas where most familes live in one or 2 rooms in unfinished blocks of flats .
The collection was notable for chinoiserie , and for a mechanical dining table devised by the ingenious English Abbe Wood .
Even more shocking than the corruption was the ingenious ` slave system " we found in the jail .
So various and ingenious are the defensive techniques adopted by the hunted that , in some cases , hunters find it worth their while to work together in teams .
He is a cunning military strategist : he has a ` game plan " for the war , and according to General Colin Powell , he is ` resourceful " and ` ingenious " in implementing it .
The admirably ingenious and astute orchestrators of jazz music soon learned this .
You can take a ferryboat through the harbor , past the ingenious Plover Cove reservoir , a water catchment area appropriated by damming and draining a broad inlet from the sea .
